body:
Nothing impact!
[suse-4.novalocal:23400:100:1450682036930]
trafodion@suse-4:~/esgynDB-20151121_0900-bin/dcs-2.0.0> ./bin/dcs --config /home/trafodion/esgynDB-20151121_0900-bin/dcs-2.0.0/conf org.trafodion.dcs.zookeeper.ZkUtil /trafodion/dcs/master
suse-4.novalocal
trafodion@suse-4:~/esgynDB-20151121_0900-bin/dcs-2.0.0> ./bin/dcs --config /home/trafodion/esgynDB-20151121_0900-bin/dcs-2.0.0/conf org.trafodion.dcs.zookeeper.ZkUtil /trafodion/dcs/master|tail -n 1
suse-4.novalocal
Thanks for suggestion. How about keeping it as a project since UDR might load every class at a time for each call, the smaller, the better.
README.md file is missing the Apache copyright header and that is causing the build static check to fail.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/239/
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/240/
Prefix "DB__" is reserved, the object with it cant be deleted. so renamed role name
Would it be possible just add junit test case for this fix.  Thanks
Sure, Kevin, keeping it as a separate project is fine.

Thanks. Will merge with "dcsstop/dcsstart fail in certain environments" since it's not clear under what circumstances the failure is seen. The fix is good since at the point in the script we do expect only one line to be returned.
Under which environment does this dcsstart and dcsstop fail?

In jdbc_test folder as we already have TestBatch.java program can we rename the BatchTest.java to BatchDMLTest.java as it covers the various dml statements. Also we don't want to duplicate this tests that got merged to  phoenix folder,  may be you could remove the same test from phoenix test folder.
it's very clear that when you set your log level to DEBUG or lower. the message will print out in this case. By the way, we cant promise it doesn't have WARN sometime.
Merged. As requested earlier, please update the Jira with the configuration change needed to simulate the defect. Thanks.

@hegdean Hi Anu, I don't quite understand your point. First, if the new tests need be named as BatchDMLTest.java, does it mean that the old TestBatch.java is for DDL test? But I don't see there's DDL test, batch operations are all just DML(insert/upsert/update).
Second, the code in TestBatch.java is really hard to read and maintain, lots of hardcode, test case granularity is too big (too many columns in one single table of one single test case, hard to debug), unclear test objective, nearly no comment. The main test objective I see in that code is just different data types. But Rowsets operation essentially is transaction, data type is not really the major focus. Honestly, I rather to remove this TestBatch.java, and re-write them all.

So I will just keep the new file name just like it is BatchTest.java now, rename it won't tell any difference, and later future I will replace the old TestBatch.java with more clear test cases.

And sure thing, the ones in phoenix can be removed, I will do that.
The 1/4/16 test result was spurious message from jenkins migration.
The 1/4/16 test result was spurious message from jenkins migration.

I'm guessing this code change is OK; I don't know enough about this particular code to be certain. I wanted to ask also: I noticed references to NONSTOP_SQLMX_NSK.MXCS_SCHEMA in the code (not in your changes, but earlier in SrvrCommon.cpp). I'm wondering if those are now obsolete? Do they cause problems?

Build flagged syntax error:

Thanks for comments.
Changes:
1. Remove "left join keys".
2. Fix compile error.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Hi Kevin, could you please mention the scenario and the error seen ?
The fix was verified using Postman and looking at the JSON output of the /servers/dcs/connections REST url. After a DCS restart, the JSON output only showed one set of entries.

Thanks Venkat. Changes look good to me. 

For future release we should think about adding test framework for REST component

Thanks for the much needed change Kevin - great work.

Some question/comments:
1.in SQLPROCEDURES can  PROCEDURE_TYPE be used to indicate if it is an SPJ or UDF ( or maybe REMARKS ) ?
2. Can inputParam[2] and inputParam[3] be utilized to search on a wild card procedure name ?
3. This change will be needed on the server end (mxosrvr) to support T4 and ODBC for non-multiDCS env. Would that get handled via this Jira too ?
4. Could you also add some test cases for getProcedures and getProcedureColumns ?

Thanks.
I'm confused about the extract syntax. It looks like part of it got chopped off in the comments.

Hi Arvind, as you know, DCSServer is a JAVA program and CLASSPATH is required. if you check CLASSPATH, you would notice that there are 2 kinds of jsp-api jar. One has ExpressionFactory.newInstance(), but the other one doesn't.  if JVM loaded the one doest have newInstance(), it will cause the error. Unfortunately, it occurs on my VM. Anyway, it's not reasonable to include more than one version for the same project JAR.
In general, it would be good if you can mention how this change solved the issue briefly. Neither JIRA nor the commit message didn't mention it unless I missed it somehow.

Hi Selva, flag isClosed should be false on statement initialization. And it's an internal statement that is why the last parameter of createSrvrStatement should be true. The issue is involved by those two flags.

1. Not sure since it's ok to list them out.
2. Sure.
3. I'd like to have another JIRA since MXOS is in use that we should treat it more careful.
4. Where to add? do you mean DEV unit test or QA test suit?
Thanks for the explanation. Suggest to include such information in future Jiras/pull request. Will merge in shortly.

1. If the select is listing both spjs and udfs then it will help to distinguish between the two. Seen some other products that use PROCEDURE_TYPE for the same.
2. Thanks for the change.
3. Sure - that should be ok.
4. Did mean DEV unit tests.
